intro: Mabrya geniculata subsp. flaviflora, commonly known as the yellow-flowered mabrya, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slight pubescence. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
